result.execSummary:
The defendant Noah A Hodges was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Reporter:  digital recorder  -  2:51 pm
Defendant in court with Attorney Laura Breun. Mathew Moeser appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Signed.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty.  Court accepted defendant's plea but withheld adjudication and referred defendant to the Dane County Drug Diversion Program. Drug Court Diversion Contract signed.  Bail continued.
Drug Court Diversion Contract.

Effective 11-3-16 @ 10:00 am, Defendant is to be released to Lora Hudson from Journey Mental Health. The signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.  
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
  - Defendant shall cooperate and follow all rules of the Dane County Drug Court Diversion Program.
